intro: Varronia marioniae, commonly known as Marion's varronia, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers with five petals and a distinctive red calyx. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
